page.title: 06STEELE'S OF MORETON
page.content: Steele's are haulage contractors for farmers.They employ 10 people.The 5 brothers run it and they have 4 drivers and 2 secretaries. They have 8 vehicles and re new them every 4-5 years.Alorry costs 25000 pounds and a trailer costs 18000 pounds. Altogether 400 tons of grain are carried a day.They carry wheat,barley,rape seed,beans and Canadian grain. None of the lorries travel over Moreton bridge because of their weight. Each lorry has citizan's band radio and can be contacted within a 12 mile radius. The drivers get up at 3a.m. and leave for Tilbury Docks before 7a.m. and are back at Steele's at 5p.m. From the docks the grain goes to Russia and Poland.
